column2: As a Senior 3D Artist, you will be responsible for creating high-quality 3D models, textures, and animations to bring our clients visions to life. You will collaborate closely with our creative team, including art directors, designers, and animators, to ensure that projects are delivered on time and meet the highest quality standards. You will also provide guidance and mentorship to junior artists, helping them develop their skills and grow within the company.       Responsibilities:           Create realistic and visually stunning 3D models, textures, and animations for a variety of projects, including advertising campaigns, game assets, and virtual reality experiences.         Collaborate with art directors, designers, and animators to understand project requirements and translate concepts into compelling visual assets.         Take a lead role in the development of 3D assets, ensuring they meet technical specifications and quality standards.         Provide guidance and mentorship to junior artists, offering constructive feedback and helping them improve their skills.         Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and techniques in 3D modeling, texturing, and animation, and share knowledge with the team.         Collaborate with other departments, such as production and project management, to ensure smooth workflow and timely delivery of projects.         Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute creative ideas to enhance the overall quality of our visual content.         job requirements         Bachelor s degree in fine arts, Animation, or a related field is preferred.         Minimum of six years of professional experience as a 3D Artist, with a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in modeling, texturing, and animation.         Proficiency in industry-standard software such as Autodesk Maya, 3ds Max, ZBrush, Substance Painter, or similar.         Qualifications         Strong understanding of anatomy, lighting, composition, and color theory.         Excellent attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work within tight deadlines.         Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.         Experience in mentoring or managing junior artists is a plus.         Knowledge of real-time rendering engines (e.g., Unity or Unreal Engine) is a plus.
column11: 3D, 3D modeling, Quality standards, Project management, Texturing, Animation, Workflow, Gaming, Autodesk Maya, Fine arts

column2: Role & responsibilities     Creating 3D Models : Generating accurate and detailed 3D models of architectural designs based on sketches, plans, or conceptual drawings provided by architects. Producing Renderings : Developing high-quality renderings of architectural designs using rendering software to simulate realistic lighting, materials, textures, and environmental conditions. Visualizing Design Concepts : Collaborating with architects and designers to translate design concepts and ideas into visually compelling 3D visualizations that effectively communicate the intended aesthetic and spatial qualities of the project. Iterative Design Development : Participating in the iterative design development process by creating multiple iterations of 3D models and renderings to explore different design options and concepts. Client Presentations : Assisting architects in preparing presentations for clients by creating visualizations that effectively communicate design proposals, project vision, and design intent. Interior Design Visualization : Developing interior design visualizations to showcase interior spaces, furniture layouts, material finishes, and lighting schemes for residential, commercial, or institutional projects. Exterior Visualization : Producing exterior visualizations to illustrate the architectural form, massing, facade treatments, landscaping, and contextual integration of the project within its surroundings. Quality Control : Ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and quality of 3D models and renderings produced by adhering to established standards, guidelines, and best practices in architectural visualization. Collaboration and Coordination : Collaborating with architects, designers, project managers, and other stakeholders to integrate 3D visualizations seamlessly into the design process and coordinate efforts to meet project deadlines and objectives. Technical Support : Providing technical support and expertise related to 3D modeling, rendering, and visualization software to architects and other team members as needed. Professional Development : Continuously expanding skills and knowledge through training, self-study, and staying updated with advancements in 3D modeling, rendering, and visualization technologies and techniques. Preferred candidate profile     Educational Background : A bachelor's degree or higher in architecture, interior design, graphic design, or a related field is preferred. While formal education is valuable, relevant experience and a strong portfolio of 3D visualization work can sometimes compensate for lack of formal education. Technical Skills : Proficiency in 3D modeling software such as Autodesk 3ds Max, SketchUp, Blender, or Autodesk Revit. Expertise in rendering software such as V-Ray, Corona Renderer, or Lumion. Strong understanding of architectural design principles and construction methods. Familiarity with CAD software and architectural drafting techniques. Knowledge of post-production software for image editing and compositing, such as Adobe Photoshop. Creativity and Design Skills : A keen eye for aesthetics and design composition. Ability to interpret architectural drawings, sketches, and concepts and translate them into visually compelling 3D visualizations. Creative problem-solving skills to address design challenges and optimize visual impact. Portfolio : A strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of 3D visualization work, including interior and exterior renderings, architectural animations, and virtual reality experiences. The portfolio should demonstrate technical proficiency, creativity, attention to detail, and the ability to effectively communicate design concepts. Communication and Collaboration : Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with architects, designers, and other team members. Ability to understand and interpret design briefs, feedback, and revisions. Strong presentation skills to communicate design ideas and concepts to clients and stakeholders. Attention to Detail and Quality Focus : A meticulous approach to work with a focus on accuracy, consistency, and quality in 3D modeling, rendering, and post-production. Time Management and Adaptability : Capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements and timelines. Continuous Learning and Growth : Willingness to stay updated with the latest trends, technologies, and techniques in architectural visualization through self-directed learning, training, and professional development opportunities. Team Player : Ability to work collaboratively as part of a multidisciplinary team, contribute ideas, and support colleagues to achieve common goals and project objectives. Professionalism : Demonstrated professionalism, integrity, and reliability in all aspects of work, including communication, project management, and client interactions. Overall, the ideal candidate for an architectural 3D visualizer position in an architect's firm combines technical expertise, creative flair, effective communication skills, and a passion for architectural visualization and design. Perks and benefits       Competitive Salary : A competitive salary annual increment based on new skill development relevant to the designation. Health Insurance : Comprehensive health insurance coverage, including maternity on successful completion of 1st year employment. Retirement Plans : Employer-sponsored retirement plans or pension plans, to help employees for their future financial security. Paid Time Off : Paid vacation days, holidays, and sick leave to allow employees to rest, recharge, and attend to personal matters without sacrificing their income. Flexible Work Arrangements : Flexible work hours, telecommuting options, or remote work opportunities to promote work-life balance on genuine time management terms. Professional Development : Opportunities for professional growth and development through training programs, workshops, conferences, and educational reimbursement on specific company terms & policies. Performance Bonuses : Performance-based bonuses, incentives, or profit-sharing arrangements for their contributions to the success of the firm. Company Culture : A positive and inclusive company culture that values diversity, collaboration, creativity, and mutual respect among employees.

We specialize in project design services for residential, commercial, and office interiors in a turnkey model, Design consultation services for new projects as well as renovation services. Proficiency in relevant software and tools Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines. Strong communication and collaboration skills Experience in the commercial interior design industry is mandatory. column2: VFX compositing seamlessly integrates digital assets with live-action footage to bring together the final shot of a film or game.      The VFX Compositor Create the Final Image of Frame, Shot or Sequence. They take all the different digital materials used (assets), such as computer-generated (CG) images, live action footage and matte paintings, and combine them to appear as one cohesive image and shot.ACTIVITIES:      ACTIVITIES:        Realistic lighting is a key , Anything caused by light hitting a lens is a compositors responsibility. They relight in order to improve the look of the image.      Compositors do chroma keying (also just called keying). This is where they select a specific part of an image that has a distinct colour or lighting and extract it to be used elsewhere. This method is      commonly used with green screen or blue screen footage, where a subject has been shot in front of a singularly green or blue background, in order to be able to place the subject in a different      setting or environment later, in post-production.      Creating convincing shadows within a shot.      Adding motion blur to scenes      Integrating rear projection into background images      Working with blue/green screen effects      Ability to do some keying, rotoscoping and creating mattes as required.      Conducting quality assurance of visuals and correcting errors before final composition      Proficiency in cinematic lighting, how shadows work in the real world.      Good working knowledge of the post-production process, especially the FX department.        COMPETENCIES:        Solid knowledge of a broad range of software      Career training in VFX compositing and a strong demo reel      Ability to analyse visual elements and make them consistent throughout      Knowledge of the visual effects pipeline      Proficiency in cinematic lighting, how shadows work in the real world      Good working knowledge of the post-production process, especially the FX department      Understanding of visual storytelling and editing      Ability to keep resources and teams on schedule and within budget      Knowledge of compositing programs be adept at using relevant programs such as After Effects, Blackmagic Fusion, Houdini, Maya, Nuke and Photoshop.
column11: nuke, photoshop, lighting, houdini
